title: 114_hr4995
content: The Act titled "Preventing Iran's Access to United States Dollars Act of 2016" prohibits certain transactions involving the Government of Iran or Iranian persons. The President is prohibited from issuing licenses under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act for offshore US dollar clearing systems involving Iran or Iranian entities. Definitions include "entity" as a business entity and "foreign financial institution" as defined by the Act. The term "financial institution" is defined by the Secretary of the Treasury under the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions Act. "Person" refers to an individual or entity. SEC. 3. REPORTS ON, AND AUTHORIZATION OF IMPOSITION OF SANCTIONS WITH RESPECT TO OFFSHORE UNITED STATES DOLLAR CLEARING FOR TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING THE GOVERNMENT OF IRAN OR IRANIAN PERSONS. The Secretary of the Treasury must submit reports every 90 days listing financial institutions involved in offshore US dollar clearing with Iran and provide a detailed assessment of efforts. The Secretary of the Treasury must submit reports every 90 days listing financial institutions involved in offshore US dollar clearing with Iran and provide a detailed assessment of efforts to prevent such transactions. The President is authorized to impose sanctions on financial institutions specified in the reports. The President can impose sanctions on financial institutions involved in offshore US dollar clearing with Iran. Additional sanctions can be imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. SEC. 4 clarifies that freezing assets of Iranian financial institutions includes assets held by a United States person through a U-turn transaction. Section 1245(c) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012 is amended to include provisions regarding U-turn transactions and book transfers involving Iranian financial institutions. The amendment includes provisions on U-turn transactions and book transfers involving Iranian financial institutions, stating that property transfers between accounts of the same institution are considered property of the Iranian financial institution.
